docs.snippet: As Brazil celebrates its selection as host for the 2016 Summer Olympics, prepares to host the 2014 World Cup and enjoys its qualification for the 2010 Cup, its fiercest rival in South America, Argentina, has been gripped by the unthinkable.      With...
docs.lead_paragraph: As Brazil celebrates its selection as host for the 2016 Summer Olympics, prepares to host the 2014 World Cup and enjoys its qualification for the 2010 Cup, its fiercest rival in South America, Argentina, has been gripped by the unthinkable. With two games to play, Argentina, which won the World Cup in 1978 and 1986, and has not missed a Cup since 1970, is in danger of not qualifying for the tournament in South Africa next summer.

headline.main: A Job That's Far From Done

docs.snippet: Diego Maradona indicated he might quit as coach of Argentina, even if his team qualified for the World Cup, unless his conditions are met.
docs.lead_paragraph: Diego Maradona is nobody's punching bag. Maradona, the beleaguered Argentina coach, indicated Wednesday that he might quit as coach of the national team, even if Argentina managed to qualify for the World Cup finals in South Africa.
docs.abstract: Diego Maradona indicated he might quit as coach of Argentina, even if his team qualified for the World Cup, unless his conditions are met.

headline.main: Maradona Insists on His Own Terms

docs.snippet: The 2010 soccer World Cup starts, in a sense, this year. There are 75 qualifying matches scheduled around the world for Saturday and Wednesday, and some of them have become eliminators.
docs.lead_paragraph: The 2010 soccer World Cup starts, in a sense, this year. There are 75 qualifying matches scheduled around the world for Saturday and Wednesday, and some of them have become eliminators.

headline.main: For World Cup Hopefuls Large and Small, the Future Is Now
headline.print_headline: For World Cup Hopefuls Large and Small, the Future Is Now

docs.snippet: A tie against Ireland was enough to seal qualification for the Italians, who joined Germany, Denmark, Serbia and the Ivory Coast in the field.
docs.lead_paragraph: A tie against Ireland was enough to seal qualification for the Italians, who joined Germany, Denmark, Serbia and the Ivory Coast in the field.

headline.seo: Italy Among Several Teams That Claim World Cup Berths
headline.main: Mexico and Italy Among Seven Teams That Claim 2010 Places
headline.print_headline: Field Is Starting to Fill Up As Several Teams Qualify

docs.snippet: Few will soon forgot the final five minutes or so of Saturday night's tumultuous South American World Cup qualifying match between a desperate Argentina and a desolate Peru at Estadio Monumental in Buenos Aires.
docs.lead_paragraph: The hero of Argentina's sputtering World Cup campaign owns an ignominious place in the Guiness Book of World Records.
docs.abstract: Few will soon forgot the final five minutes or so of Saturday night's tumultuous South American World Cup qualifying match between a desperate Argentina and a desolate Peru at Estadio Monumental in Buenos Aires.

docs.snippet: If anyone wonders why soccer, a simple and a single game, has such a hold on different peoples across the globe, Saturday and Sunday gave some answers.
docs.lead_paragraph: If anyone wonders why soccer, a simple and a single game, has such a hold on different peoples across the globe, Saturday and Sunday gave some answers.

headline.main: The World’s Game Weaves Its Magic
headline.print_headline: The World's Game Works Its Magic Again

docs.snippet: The two-year qualifying marathon for the 2010 World Cup in South Africa is a few weeks from a conclusion.
docs.lead_paragraph: The two-year qualifying marathon for the 2010 World Cup in South Africa will conclude Nov. 14, when all the loose ends will be tied in a tidy knot. Games scheduled for Wednesday will also do much to sort out matters.
docs.abstract: The two-year qualifying marathon for the 2010 World Cup in South Africa is a few weeks from a conclusion.

headline.main: After Qualifying Marathon, the Final Sprint to South Africa

docs.snippet: After more than two years, the contest to whittle down 201 countries to the 32 that will go to the World Cup in South Africa next year is down to its last dozen places.
docs.lead_paragraph: After more than two years, the contest to whittle down 201 countries to the 32 that will go to the World Cup in South Africa next year is down to its last dozen places.

headline.main: Down to the Wire for the World Cup
headline.print_headline: Down to the Wire for the World Cup

docs.snippet: The United States tied Costa Rica, 2-2, at R.F.K. Stadium in Washington on Wednesday night in its final qualifying game.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States tied Costa Rica, 2-2, at Robert F. Kennedy Stadium in Washington on Wednesday night in its final qualifying game. A couple of talking points to get you through the night.
docs.abstract: The United States tied Costa Rica, 2-2, at R.F.K. Stadium in Washington on Wednesday night in its final qualifying game.

headline.main: Talking Points After U.S. Rallies to Tie Costa Rica

docs.snippet: Argentina and its embattled coach, Diego Maradona, have avoided an unthinkable elimination while the United States rallied to tie Costa Rica.
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina and its embattled coach, Diego Maradona, have avoided an unthinkable elimination while the United States rallied to tie Costa Rica.

headline.seo: Argentina Waits to Nearly the Last Minute to Qualify for South Africa
